item.title: 10 Best Open World Games With Wizard Playable Characters, Ranked
item.description:
​​​If there was ever an essential class that players could choose just one from classic fantasy worlds, it would have to be wizards, right? They are some of the most iconic and imposing characters and have formed a core part of the genre ever since Gandalf the Gray was first introduced in Tolkien's The Lords of the Rings . Since then, wizards have flooded the genre, and naturally made their way into open-world video games where players can actually pick them as their go-to choice to play.

There are so many fantastic RPGs with deep innovative game mechanics that correlate directly to wizards. Mastering magic abilities and spells can be some of the most interesting and intricate parts of open-world RPGs, and naturally, wizards are the best pick for those wishing to explore this path. Let's therefore take a look at which games allow players to play as a wizard in rich, vibrant open-world designs.

10 Wizardry Franchise

The Staple Dungeon-Crawling Franchise for Wizard Aficionados

The Wizardry franchise is one of the most iconic and important dungeon crawlers to have ever existed. It paved the way for fantasy games as we know them today with the first game in this series releasing all the way back in 1981 with Wizardry: Proving Ground of the Mad Overlord , which had a more recent remake. Even way back then, this series featured some intricate RPG mechanics where players had to seriously pay attention to their stats and abilities. Whilst not necessarily traditional open-world settings, players are given absolute freedom to explore open dungeons at their own pace and in whichever order they like, much of which is even procedurally generated!

Earlier titles featured a mechanic similar to Dungeons & Dragons whereby spells and spell slots had to have a rest period before being used again, meaning players had to constantly micromanage their utilities. There are different spell classes in each title and new sets of robes to adorn in a vast labyrinth of seemingly endless rooms. It's the ultimate hardcore dungeon-crawler franchise and one of the best picks for players looking to play as a wizard.

9 Citadel: Forged with Fire

A Sandbox RPG Exclusively for Wizards!

  • Released: July 22, 2017
  • Developers: Blue Isle Studios
  • Platforms: PS4, Xbox One, PC

There aren't any traditional melee weapons or classes to be found in this epic open-world RPG. Instead, Citadel: Forged With Fire introduces a unique weapon system made with wizards specifically in mind. Everything is essentially enhanced by spells here, where players customize their spell loadouts based on certain schools of magic.

It features an intricate spellcasting system using a substance called Essence which players earn, and these can then be used to upgrade each school of magic and ultimately forge new spells. It goes much deeper than that too, as depending on how players craft and level their spells, stats like damage, range, and effectiveness can all vary greatly, making for some of the most authentic wizarding experiences in gaming. Pair that with being able to fly around a huge open world on broomsticks and there's a winning formula.

8 Two Worlds 2

Wizarding Magic Systems Featuring Customizable Spells

Two Worlds 2 also features an impressively innovative spell-crafting experience using a system that the game refers to as DEMONS (Dynamic Enchantment, Magic, Occultism & Necromancy System). Essentially, players can create spells from scratch by combining different magical elements which allows for some great trial and error in finding the perfect combinations. It also allows for some really creative gameplay as further effects can be stacked on top of each spell which means enemies might explode or levitate and then explode upon their death or upon the spell being cast.

It's a great spell sandbox system which makes it a great world to explore as a wizard. Magic in the game is so much more powerful than any of the other combat options, it actually makes players question why they would even consider not playing as a wizard. That being said, finding spell cards for the spellcrafting can be a bit tedious and it's not exactly a straightforward system. But it's certainly an amazing open-world title that is best experienced by players assuming the role of a wizard character!

7 Dragon's Dogma Franchise

Elemental Magic in Sprawling Open Worlds!

Both Dragon's Dogma 1 and 2 feature the two classes, Mage or Sorcerer. Both of which are essentially wizard classes with some slight variations. Spells are cast by charging them up, which often makes them seem extremely powerful. The wizarding gameplay here is also a lot more tactical than many other RPGs, perhaps more akin to that of an MMO. Positioning really matters and players won't be able to get away with simply button-mashing their spells.

Dragon's Dogma 2 features one of the most impressive open worlds from recent RPG releases, and its fun and effective gameplay further enhances the quality of the game. Of course, players don't have to play as a wizard, but the sorcerer is definitely one of the most powerful and entertaining classes in the game, making it a perfect choice to play as a wizard.

6 Hogwarts Legacy

There's Nothing Greater Than Being a Wizarding Student of Hogwarts

It's hard not to mention Harry Potter when talking about wizards, and that makes Hogwarts Legacy one of the best titles to examine when looking at games with wizard playable characters. Not only is it a fantastic open-world experience, but it also does a great job of nailing the wizarding mechanics that fans would expect from such a prominent franchise.

There aren't any classes to pick from here, because it's a given that players will be playing as a wizard, but they can nurture their own builds through learning new spells and equipping different wands. Combo-based spellcasting makes Hogwarts Legacy a truly thrilling experience and the open world is designed to immerse the player in the wizarding world of Harry Potter . It's one of the ultimate wizarding experiences in gaming.

5 The Elder Scrolls Franchise

The Elder Scrolls Provides Infinite Replayability for Mages and Wizards

The Elder Scrolls franchise is to gaming what The Lord of the Rings was to literature - genre-defining. Almost every fantasy title since the release of The Elder Scrolls: Arena in 1994 owes some form of inspiration to the series, and it continues to showcase its legacy even today. It's the most recent titles that are a major highlight when it comes to being able to play as a wizard, and it's actually The Elder Scrolls III: Morrowind that features the best wizard abilities.

Morrowind allows complete freedom in spellcasting and features 6 magic schools, including destruction, alteration, illusion, conjuration, restoration, and mysticism. Players can fully customize their spells, directly affecting their range, power, or duration, based on varying mana requirements. Morrowind also features one of the best open worlds to interact with as a wizard playable character, including wizard-exclusive abilities like flying, water walking, and teleportation.

4 Dragon Age: Inquisition

Some of the Best Spell Animations in a Lively, Vibrant World

Players can pick to play as a mage in Dragon Age: Inquisition , which is once again synonymous with the standard wizard class. Magic is essential in this game, so, naturally, it's a great choice to play as a wizard playable character. Players can tailor their play styles to be more defensive or offensive based on their preferences surrounding the magic system, but wizards are perhaps the most powerful choice of character type in the game.

The fun begins when players hit level 10, where they can then choose a unique wizard path through specialization skills, including knight enchanters, necromancers, or rift mages. Each of these features a unique playstyle which will make one playthrough completely different from another, so players will need to choose wisely based on how they want their wizard playable character to carry out combat. Magic can be used by wizards beyond combat in puzzle areas, unlocking further exploration and closing rifts.

3 Outward

Become a Full-Fledged Wizard with Powerful Rituals and Spells

Outward features an in-depth magic system where playing as a wizard will be an incredibly challenging yet highly rewarding experience. It might seem easy to learn the basics, but it requires some time and dedication to properly master the spellcasting system here. If players manage to do so, however, they're in for one of the best wizard playable character experiences in gaming.

There isn't any traditional mana regeneration, and players don't even have access to any magic until they've sacrificed a certain amount of their max health and stamina. It's an immersive system where players aren't simply pressing buttons to cast spells; it aims to capture the whole spellcasting ritual. Once again, there are different magic schools so that players can pick and choose their spells, and wizarding gameplay directly affects the open-world design by illuminating caves with light magic or weather-based protection spells. It's a magic system that works in synergy with the world around the player, making it a perfect choice for wizard playable characters.

2 Divinity: Original Sin 2

Deep Spellcasting Customization in this Turn-Based Epic

A highly regarded masterpiece, Divinity: Original Sin 2 remains one of the best open-world fantasy titles ever made, and it's a great choice to play as a wizard character here. Magic is tied directly to every aspect of the game, from combat to exploration; it's essential for the player. Cooldown times and action points allow for a more seamless experience with magic. Players will still have to manage their spells and abilities, but it's a bit of a more forgiving experience compared to more hardcore mechanics.

That's not to say it's simple by any means. There are eight magic-based skill trees that players will have to manage and combining these through experimenting can create some of the most powerful and effective spells and abilities in the game. On top of this, spells react not only to the environment but also to each other, allowing for multiple chain reactions and combo building. It's a system that seems simple at first, but players will have an endlessly fun time diving into the intricate mechanics if they choose to play as a wizard playable character.

1 Baldur's Gate 3

Taking all the Right Wizard Mechanics from Dungeons & Dragons to Video Games

It was only a matter of time before the wizard mechanics from Dungeons & Dragons became fully integrated into video games, and Baldur's Gate 3 achieves exactly that to grand effect. Sure, Baldur's Gate 3 is a bit of a blurred line between an RPG and an Open-World, but with wizarding mechanics so fledged, it's hard not to give it a pass. Straight off the bat, players can take a deep dive into the character creation and create a compelling and immersive wizard playable character like none other. There's not a lot more that needs to be said about this fantastic title, but it sure is the definitive pick for a wizard playable character.

The turn-based combat in the game takes direct inspiration from its tabletop counterpart, meaning players will have to manage their spell slots, items, and abilities strategically . Players can also utilize the multi-class system to build an even more powerful wizard playable character. It's got one of the most immersive and richly detailed open worlds in gaming, some of the best magic and spellcasting systems, and it's a perfect recreation of virtual Dungeons & Dragons . Players should jump at the chance to take on the role of a wizard playable character here.

item.title: Baldur's Gate 3: 15 Fun Overpowered Builds
item.description:
Summary

  • Baldur's Gate 3 offers various class builds for overpowered characters, from Battle Master Fighters to College of Valor Bards.
  • Multi-classing can enhance any BG3 build further, allowing players to experiment with deadly combinations.
  • Options like the Tempest Cleric, Way of the Open-Hand Monk, and Light Domain Cleric offer unique playstyles and strengths.

Players like RPGs because they can customize their characters even down to the smallest detail, and Baldur's Gate 3 has a lot to offer when it comes to unique and powerful builds. An overpowered build for a class in a role-playing game is always fun to play and customize, but what exactly makes a character "overpowered" might be a matter of opinion.

Players have already invented several deadly combinations of race, feat, gear, and weapons to make an overpowered build in Baldur's Gate 3 . With the last substantial patch set to drop any day now, there are even more possibilities for fun and exciting class, race, and gear combinations.

Updated March 25, 2025, by Kristy Ambrose: Baldur's Gate 3 is still one of the world's most popular games long after its original launch. Considering how much detail the writers and developers have added to classes, dialogue, and character interactions, the adventure is always different depending on the character that players build. Any of the following BG3 builds, including the latest addition to this list featuring a new Monk subclass, can be further changed or augmented using multi-classing, which can allow players to experiment even further.

1 Battle Master Fighter

Extra Actions Means Extra Action

  • A drawback of any Fighter build is that it doesn't have any healing or spellcasting powers, except the Eldritch Fighter subclass. However, every build using this class has the benefit of Action Surge, which provides the character with a crucial extra Action during combat. Additionally, Second Wind draws on the Constitution score to restore hit points.

The Battle Master focuses on melee fighting. In addition to some ridiculous bonuses in that category, players can pad them with gear, Background, and Feat choices.

  • Race: The Zariel Tiefling is always a nice start to a melee build, with racial abilities like Searing Smith and Branding Smite. Other decent choices include Orcs, with abilities like Savage Attacks and Relentless Endurance. Humans also have the benefit of the Civil Militia.
  • Feats: Alert, so the character can get the first attack. Any Feat that gives a reaction when it comes to countering enemy attacks is also helpful. These include Mage Slayer and Sentinel. Savage Attacker and Resilient are also ideal for anyone in melee range and ideal for the Battlemaster build.
  • Gear: There is some exceptional heavy armor in the game, and this mostly-melee Fighter build can take advantage of it. The Adamantine Splint Armour is an early example. Any variety of broadsword is also a good bet, so it's worth getting Zhalk's Everburn Blade from the Nautiloid.

2 Fiery Sorcerer

The Classic Overpowered Character

  • Combine innate spellcasting with a large selection of Fire-based spells with this overpowered build.

There are several spellcasting classes in BG3 , and the Sorcerer has the best casting abilities with the spell slots they have available. Making them a Fire-based caster gives them more choices for spells, and the result is an overpowered caster with a talent for blazing destruction.

  • Race: High Elves and half-High Elves have access to the Firebolt cantrip, and the Charisma boost is also helpful. Choose a Mephistopheles Tiefling to get access to spells like Burning Hands and Flame Blade.
  • Feats: Elemental Adept is obvious, and the natural choice is fire. Resilient is also a good choice, with a boost to either Charisma or Dexterity. Sentinel ensures this Sorcerer will never be Surprised and will often get the opportunity to take the first turn in battle.
  • Gear: The Elven Chain is always great for a character with a low or non-existent AC, and Creation's Echo is a Quarterstaff that makes the wielder immune to the damage type of their choice.

3 The Beastmaster Ranger

A Savage Companion

  • When playing the game, fans can choose any Ranger subclass for Minsc that they want, but considering he's always in the company of his animal companion, it makes sense that he would be a Beastmaster.

Every Ranger build has some options for animal companions, but this is the one that makes the concept central to their skills and abilities.

  • Race: This versatile class can be virtually any race, but any type of Elf (including Drow) and Humans are ideal because of the melee and ranged weapon skills they have. Dwarves are also a good choice because of the poison and magic resistance along with the Constitution buff.
  • Feats: Alert gives a +5 bonus to Initiative and ensures that neither the Ranger nor his minions can be Surprised. Sentinel gives the Ranger Opportunity Attacks against enemies that target their allies within melee range. Equip the Ranger with a long-ranged melee weapon, like a spear or polearm, to make this Feat even more effective.
  • Gear: The Armour of Landfall is an ideal choice but it doesn't turn up until Sorcerer's Sundries in Act 3. Until then, look for anything that buffs the Ranger's Constitution or Wisdom.

4 The Tempest Cleric

Become Holy Thor

  • All the most potent benefits of the Cleric, such as Guiding Bolt and Spirit Guardians, combined with the might of the Tempest, which includes ridiculous AoE spells like Shatter and Ice Storm.

This class can be an overpowered elemental nightmare at melee or distance range, and the race and feats haven't even been chosen yet.

  • Race: Any Half-Elf race has access to cantrips like Darkness, Faerie Fire, or Fire Bolt, all handy spells depending on the build, and High Elves can choose from a selection taken from the Wizard class. For those who want a more melee-based Holy Thor build, the Zariel Tiefling is the best choice. Searing Smith and Branding Smite are powerful racial abilities, and Thaumaturgy is handy for certain dice rolls.
  • Feats: Elemental Adept is perfect for those who want even more boom and bust for their lightning and thunder spells. War Caster, which includes the spell Shocking Grasp, is another good choice.
  • Gear: The Blood of Lathander grants the use of Sunbeam, and Ketheric's Warhammer does psychic as well as bludgeoning damage. Several maces and hammers in the game work well with this build and remember that a smaller hammer can be combined with a shield for extra AC and bludgeoning damage.

5 Circle Of The Spores Druid

The Slow Rot To Victory

  • Druids are a powerful combination class, and players can build them as healers, defenders, and/or damage dealers.

The Circle of Spores leans into the DPS category, with DoT abilities like Fungal Infestation and Blight, but still has some of the shapeshifting and healing abilities to make them just as useful in a support role.

  • Race: Drow, Half-Elves, and Asmodeus Tieflings are a decent choice here, with access to a range of Cantrips that include Darkness and Faerie Fire . The Deep Gnome has a Stealth advantage if the character is more of a DPS build than a healer or defender.
  • Feats: Take advantage of a high Intelligence or Wisdom stat and get Magic Initiate: Wizard or Cleric to add a few more spells to the already impressive array of choices.
  • Gear: The rare Hollow's Staff makes a lot of sense with this build because it deals both bludgeoning and necrotic damage, which matches nicely with abilities like Symbiotic Entity.

6 Drunken Master Monk

A Subclass Based On A Real-Life Technique

  • Use the power of passive force to confuse and defeat enemies.

One of the new subclasses introduced in Patch 8 was the Drunken Master for the Monk class, and the key to its power is the ability to use an enemy's momentum and energy against them. This Monk is immune to the effects of alcohol, and players can suffer from the Drunk condition. Wisdom, Dexterity, and Constitution are the three most important ability scores for this class, and this subclass values Dexterity and Constitution the most.

  • Race. Wood Elves and Drow are good choices with their extra movement and abilities like Darkvision. Other decent choices are the Half-orc, with abilities like Relentless Endurance, or the Gold Dwarf, which has an extra hit point per level.
  • Feats. Anything that gives the Monk better AC, buffs to Constitution, or more hit points is ideal. The Feats Durable and Resilient help in both factors and Lightly Armored gives the Monk the ability to wear armor—normally Monks can only wear Clothing, like a spellcaster.
  • Gear. The Gloves of Dexterity bring the Monk's most important ability score to 18, and they can be found fairly early in Crèche Y'llek from vendor A'jak'nir Jeera. The Graceful Cloth is a chest piece with the same Dexterity buff, which Lady Esther is selling by the Roseymorne Trail.

7 A Light-Blessed Druid

Both Classes Use Wisdom

  • For an overpowered healer or a DPS build, this multiclass can heal, shapeshift, and use several different weapons and armor.

Experimenting with multiclassing is another way to bring a character to that next overpowered level, and a great place to start is the Cleric and Druid combination. Subclasses and Feats may vary, but one of the most powerful subclasses is the Light Domain, and a Druid that combines this with the Circle of the Moon has just created a devastating casting and healing build.

  • Race: High Elves and half-High Elves have a choice of cantrips, which works nicely with a DPS build. Humans can give the class more weapon options, Halflings have the Lucky Feat as one of their racial skills, and Tieflings have better Fire Resistance along with extra casting abilities.
  • Feats: Alert keeps a healer or caster from being surprised and gives them a bonus to Initiative. Durable gives them a handy boost to Constitution for more hit points and better regeneration. Elemental Adept gives a character the ability to cast spells without the danger of a critical miss along with increased resistance to their elemental damage of choice.
  • Gear: Anything that increases Wisdom, which is the most important Ability Score for both of these classes, is the main priority. Amulet of the Harpers , which grants an Advantage to Wisdom saving throws, is one example.

8 Arcane Trickster Rogue

The Best Of Two Deadly Worlds

  • Every party needs a Rogue anyway, and there might be some debate as to which combination would be more overpowered, the Arcane Trickster subclass or a Rogue-Wizard or Sorcerer multiclass.

A few basic magical abilities paired with the right gear and Feat choices make this variation on the Rogue OP enough without the former spellbook.

  • Race: Any race that has their choice of cantrips or Stealth enhancement abilities, which includes most Elf subraces, Gnomes, and Halflings. Those who want abilities like Faerie Fire or a cantrip can start with Elves or Half-Elves.
  • Feats: This build already has access to several spells, so enhance these existing abilities with Spell Sniper or Elemental Adept. Alert is always great, not only because it improves Initiative, but also ensures that the character can't be surprised.
  • Gear: The shortsword Crimson Mischief drops from Orin in Act 2, and it does both piercing and necrotic damage in addition to a condition called Redevin Savagery. The sword does extra piercing damage if the player has Advantage, as they often do in Stealth situations.

9 Gloomstalker Ranger

The Night Belongs To Us

  • It might be situational, but the environment in Baldur's Gate 3 could have been made for the Gloomstalker. A lot is going on in dark places with extraplanar beings in this story, and this subclass has the Arcane and History proficiencies to know them and find them.

The Gloomstalker can be a ranged or melee build, with abilities like Dread Ambusher giving this character the first strike in a battle applicable to both types of attack.

  • Race: Any class that gets bonuses to Stealth, Darkvision, or movement is ideal. These include the Wood Elf, or any subrace Halfling, Drow, or Gnome. The Duergar have inherent skills like Cast Invisibility but are not as mobile or stealthy.
  • Feats: Alert improves Initiative and ensures the character can't be surprised, and Mobile Increases speed and mobility in any terrain. Combine this with the Dread Ambrusher and the targets die before they know what hit them.
  • Gear: The Amulet of Bhaal isn't just used to unlock the temple's inner sanctum. It gives the target the Bleed condition if they have full hit points, which is perfect for the Gloomstalker, who strikes first from the shadows. The Sharpened Snare Curiass is available from a vendor in Act 2, and it's one of the best chest pieces any Ranger can have.

10 The College Of Valor Bard

Two Weapons, No Waiting

  • For those new to the world of D&D or turn-based gaming, this is the class that more experienced players often recommend. It's the best of the other subclasses combined and can take almost any party role, so not often one that's thought of as overpowered.

This melee build makes them more like Rogues or Fighters when it comes to damage dealing. It includes some extra spells and weapon skills, making this Bard build an overpowered rockstar.

  • Race: Tieflings, Dragonborn, and Elves have the most going for them when it comes to Dexterity modifiers and extra spell slots. Halflings are known for their Charisma and are often employed as traders and entertainers along the Sword Coast.
  • Feats: Mage Slayer makes the character even more deadly to casters in Melee range, and Dual Wielder allows them to become a flurry of sharp bits in melee range.
  • Gear: The Spectator Eyes , an amulet found in the Underdark, allows players to add two more spells to this build if they think it is too reliant on physical damage.

11 The Gloomstalker Assassin

A Ranger Combined With A Deadly Rogue Subclass

  • A melee or ranged build that relies on physical as opposed to magical damage with the mutual interest in Dexterity.

The Gloomstalker Ranger is already a class to be reckoned with, and combining it with one of the best Rogue builds the Assassin, makes this combination even more deadly. Rangers have some handy support spells that carry into this build so they can still help with healing and de-cursing along with precise and lethal abilities in battle and stealth.

  • Race: Darkvision is an important ability for this build, so any Elf, especially Drow, is ideal. Halflings and Gnomes, who not only have this ability but also Advantage when it comes to movement Stealth, are also great choices.
  • Feats: Athlete increases Dexterity or Consitution by +1 and allows the character to recover more quickly from a prone position. Crossbow Expert eliminates penalties for close-range shots, and Dual Wielder adds even more weapon options to this already versatile class.
  • Gear: This multiclass combines all of the best things about a Dexterity-based class, so players should look for anything that buffs this essential stat. The Ranger gives the Rogue more choices when it comes to armor, but one option for any class is the Elven Chain , a rare piece of medium armor that gives Advantage to Initiative and Dexterity saving throws.

12 Way Of The Open-Hand Monk

No Weapons, No Problem

  • Not all Monk subclasses give up on weapons entirely, but this one does, and it's still brutal without them.

The Way of the Open Hand focuses on unarmed attacks. The variety offered with the different Flurry of Blows options available gives this build several ways to be as effective as any conventional fighting class. Every Monk subclass has access to skills that improve their movement capabilities, like Step of the Wind, and that makes everything the Way of the Open Hand can do even faster.

  • Race: Yet another great thing about this build is that it's hard to go wrong when choosing a race, as long as players prioritize Dexterity and Constitution scores. Wisdom is also important for spellcasting abilities.
  • Feats: Athlete not only speeds up the ability to recover from a Prone position but also improves the Strength or Dexterity score. Another good choice is Durable, which raises the Constitution score.
  • Gear: It seems that the Monk's choices would be limited, especially this build, which doesn't use weapons. Monks can wear Clothing as opposed to armor, and there are several varieties in the game for different builds. The Drunken Cloth and Boots of Uninhibited Kushigo are two examples.

13 Oath Of Vengeance Paladin

A Moral Obligation For Justice

  • Fighting evil without mercy, and righting a wrong by any means necessary, along with some extra Radiant Damage.

In BG3 , "light" damage is referred to as Radiant damage, and it's commonly used by Paladins and Clerics. This is the Paladin subclass that not only has a buff in their ability to do radiant damage but has also been given permission to use it without mercy against their foes.

  • Race: Dragonborn are known for their casting ability and their intimidating presence. Other decent choices are Humans and Half-orcs, each of which has opportunities to improve important Paladin stats like Strength and Constitution.
  • Feats: Athlete increases Strength or Dexterity by 2, and Charger helps the Paladin defend their allies.
  • Gear: Adamantine Splint Armour ensures that nobody can strike the Paladin with a critical hit, and the Blade of Oppressed Souls has the power to possibly inflict the target with Crown of Madness.

14 Light Domain Cleric

Shine Bright And Burn It All

  • Certain subclasses get overlooked just because they don't appear that exciting at first glance or get lost among the other choices.

With choices like Tempest, War, and Life, which are notoriously the most popular Domains among a total of seven, it's easy to forget the power of the Light.

  • Race: A High Elf, or half High-elf, because the Flaming Bolt Cantrip comes with it and complements the light-based build. Other choices with extra firepower include the Asmodeus and Mephistopheles Tieflings.
  • Feats: Elemental Adept: Fire, should players stay with the fire-based build, Spell Sniper will improve their hit chance by +1 and give them one more Cantrip of your choice.
  • Gear: This is mainly a DPS and healing role, any weapons will be more about buffs and extra spells than melee fighting. The Blood of Lathander and Selune's Spear of Night are both ideal choices.

15 Wild Magic Barbarian

Destructive Fun

  • The whole concept of Wild Magic is a lot of fun when paired with its usual class, the Sorcerer. However, the Barbarian has the weapon and fighting prowess to make this build even more heavy-hitting, entertaining, and random.

It's not just the extra magical abilities that make this build OP, but also the positive buffs that can extend to other party members. Bolstering Magic: Boon is a passive ability that gives allies within range a 1d4 bonus to Ability Checks and Attack Rolls.

  • Race: Zariel Tieflings have some impressive melee abilities, and Half-orcs have an ability called Relentless Endurance that keeps their hit points from hitting zero. Of course, any character with a high Strength score is fine, but keep in mind that this is a melee build, so a race with magical abilities should choose melee-ranged spells.
  • Feats: Get Martial Adept, and choose Riposte and Sweeping Attack.
  • Gear: Slay Sarevok, again, and he drops the Sword of Chaos , again. This greatsword not only looks impressive, but it does also both piercing and necrotic damage, and every time it does damage it returns hit points to the wielder.

item.title: Where to Find All Yokai in Assassin's Creed Shadows
item.description:
Assassin's Creed Shadows takes a decidedly different approach to side quests than the previous RPG entries in the series. As you make your way through the game, you'll encounter various criminal organizations with several members. Yasuke and Naoe will have to track down each member of the organization, earning rewards for defeating each member, as well as for completing the quest as a whole. " The Yokai " is one such quest, providing the player with clues to help locate six "Yokai" around the map. In this guide, we'll show you where to find all six Yokai in Assassin's Creed Shadows .

Where to FInd All Six Yokai in Assassin's Creed Shadows

How to Start "The Yokai":

You can begin this quest by speaking to Mamushi at the Hills of Meaning POI, in Yamashiro . We discovered this quest through a rumor which was learned after helping a NPC in trouble during a random encounter. However, if you know Mamushi's location in Yamashiro, you can visit him at any time to start the quest.

All Yokai Locations:

Yokai Name

Region

Where to Find

Map Image

Yuki Onna

Omi

You'll find Yuki Onna standing outside Kawachi Kaza-ana Cave, in northeastern Omi. The cave is almost directly between the Suzuka Foothills and the Ibu Highlands. You can only find Yuki Onna in Winter.

Daitengu

Harima

You'll find Daitengu at the Arima Onsen, a group of hot springs northeast of the Kakogawa Estuary in Harmia. You'll see him practicing his sword forms on a riverbank. Make sure to grab the Legendary Chest just north of Daitengu's small camp.

Kappa

Yamashiro

You'll find the Kappa in the Haunted Tatarigami Village, in the Genbu Highlands province of Yamashiro. The Kappa will only come out at night, near the stream to the east of the haunted village. Make sure not to attack the Kappa, as they are actually starving children. Instead, follow them back to the thieves' camp and speak to them.

Bakemono

Izumi Settsu

Bakemono can only be found in Summer or Fall . Bakemono are found in the northern Yamata Plains, just before the river that separates it from Ogura Pond. The location is called "Suika Lands," for reasons that will become apparent when you confront the "Bakemono."

Oshiroi Baba

Yamato

Oshiroi Baba can only be found at night . You'll find Oshiroi Baba in Yamato, in the southern section of the Nara Heartland. You can head northeast from Katsuragi to find her outside her hut. You must fight her, but a cutscene will always take over at the end of the fight. In canon mode , she will be spared.

Taka Nyudo

Tamba

Taka Nyudo has no seasonal or time restrictions. He can be found in Kabasaka Village, in The Silver Lands province of Tamba. It is located just southwest of the Kata at Narutaki Falls. He will attack on sight.

How to Complete The Yokai – Ao Andon:

Once you've defeated all six Yokai, you'll need to return to Mamushi at the Nyoiji Dyiji Temple in the Hills of Meaning. Upon arrival, Naoe will be greeted by one final enemy: Ao Andon . I'll avoid spoiling how this plays out, but it is important to know that you'll face one more boss before the end of the mission.

The Yokai FInal Rewards:

After defeating Ao Ando, you'll receive the following rewards:

  • Critical Chance With Backstab – Engraving
  • Melon Cart – Outdoor Cosmetic
  • 7000 XP

item.title: EA Sports FC 25: Best PlayStyles+ for Midfielders, Ranked
item.description:
Player cards in EA Sports FC 25 have PlayStyles, which allow players to increase specific gameplay mechanics. This customization enables players to tailor their squad to match their preferred playstyle, offering a competitive edge by mastering crucial in-game situations to help them win as many matches as possible.

For an even bigger advantage, PlayStyles+ delivers stronger enhancements than the regular versions, making them especially valuable for dominating the midfield, stopping opponents' passes, and distributing the ball quickly. With various options to choose from, here’s a rundown of the top PlayStyles+ for midfielders in EA FC 25 , selected based on their usefulness.

5 Press Proven+

Shield and Maintain Control of the Ball

Effect

Keeps exceptionally close control of the ball while dribbling at jog speed. Can shield the ball much more effectively from stronger opponents.

The primary role of most midfielders is to maintain possession and control the ball, allowing them to distribute it to attackers and set them up in the best possible positions to score. To excel in this, Press Proven+ is essential, offering exceptional ball control by keeping the ball close to the player’s feet while jogging. This allows the midfielder to assess the situation and make informed decisions, whether it’s delivering a long pass or simply moving the ball forward.

Additionally, this PlayStyle+ enables players to shield the ball more effectively against strong opponents , reducing the risk of losing possession and triggering a counterattack. To do this, simply use the function by pressing L2 (PlayStation) or LT (Xbox) while positioning your body when an opponent attempts to push you to steal the ball. Press Proven can also be easily combined with other ball control, defensive, or attacking PlayStyles to further enhance the midfielder’s performance and suit their playing style.

4 Incisive Pass+

Pass the Ball Accurately Across the Field

Effect

Through Passes are far more accurate, Swerve Passes are delivered with maximum curve, and Precision Passes travel at top speed to the destination.

Passing is crucial for midfielders when it comes to effectively distributing the ball across the field, and Incisive Pass+ is an invaluable option to enhance accuracy . It also enables players to deliver long balls to the forwards , setting them up for a one-on-one with the opposing goalkeeper. This PlayStyle+ feature allows players to maximize the swerve passes , adding more curve to their passes . By using L2 (PlayStation) or LT (Xbox) while pressing the pass or through ball button, players can achieve a sharper curve, making it harder for opponents to intercept the ball.

Another benefit of Incisive Pass+ is that precision passes travel at top speed , reducing the time it takes for the ball to reach its target. This helps play at a faster pace, confusing the opponent and limiting their time to react to the attack. With Incisive Pass+, you can ensure that your passes are perfectly executed , whether you’re assisting in an attack or playing out from the back.

3 Tiki Taka+

Keep the Play Moving Quickly Through the Midfield

Effect

Executes difficult first-time Ground Passes with even greater accuracy, using backheels when contextually appropriate. Short distance Ground Passes are exceptionally accurate.

Although its name, Tiki Taka+, might seem to only apply to the playstyle it’s named after, this PlayStyle+ is incredibly useful for players who prefer holding the ball in midfield to carefully choose the best pass . By enabling more precise first-time ground passes, players can avoid turnovers and gain a second chance to either re-establish their attack or launch a quick counterattack .

Additionally, Tiki Taka+ improves the accuracy of short-distance ground passes , allowing players to swiftly switch sides of the field and find openings to attack. However, as its name suggests, this PlayStyle+ does help players who focus on quick, continuous passing, enabling them to maintain possession and break into the opponent’s penalty area using short, precise passes rather than relying on long balls.

2 Long Ball Pass+

Long Passes That Defenders Can’t Easily Intercept

Effect

Lob and Lofted Through Passes are even more accurate, travel faster than ever, and are far more difficult to intercept.

Since the midfield serves as the crucial link between defense and attack, having a midfielder who can effectively distribute the ball forward is key . A player with this ability can set up strikers or wingers with clear opportunities against the opposing goalkeeper. This PlayStyle+ enhances Lob Passes and Lofted Through Passes , making them more accurate, faster, and harder for defenders to intercept . It allows midfielders to send long passes over opponents, giving attackers more freedom to break forward.

With passes traveling higher and being more difficult to cut off, this PlayStyle+ enables quick, unexpected attacks, making it harder for opponents to anticipate plays . Additionally, it improves wing switching , ensuring the ball reaches its target without being lost, providing multiple options for both offensive plays and counterattacks.

1 Relentless+

Keep Your Energy High by Supporting Both Defense and Attack

Effect

Greatly reduces the long-term fatigue effects on attributes, reaction time, and defensive awareness. Reduces fatigue loss during play and significantly increases fatigue recovery during halftime.

Due to their central role on the field, midfielders need strong stamina to maintain their performance throughout the game and adjust the pace when needed. Relentless+ is the ideal PlayStyle+ for this, as it significantly reduces long-term fatigue , improving both reaction time and defensive awareness . This allows players to contribute effectively in offensive bursts while also helping to contain opposing attackers.

Additionally, Relentless+ greatly enhances fatigue recovery during halftime , providing a crucial advantage for midfielders who constantly move between attack and defense. This ensures they can sustain their energy for the entire match, making them a reliable presence on the pitch.

Iansan is the character featured in the Natlan chapter of Genshin Impact 's Teyvat Chapter Storyline Preview: Travail, so most players knew about her existence long before Natlan was planned. However, not many expected her to be a 4-star character, although it's a possibility considering the featured character from Liyue is Ningguang, who's also a 4-star unit.
